title: Survey-Based Instructional Design Process for Improving Preservice Teachers' Perceptions of Online Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of online learning concepts and teaching experience
context.additional_context: Analysis of preservice teachers' perceptions of online learning effectiveness considering cultural backgrounds and age, and development of improvement strategies

learning_goals: Learners can explain the four dimensions (instructor characteristics, social presence, instructional design, trust) that evaluate online learning perceptions.
Learners can design a survey analyzing differences in online learning perceptions based on target learner characteristics (age/culture).
Learners can propose at least two mobile microlearning strategies suitable for mathematics curriculum characteristics based on survey results.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
